intro: Canavalia prolifica, commonly known as the evergreen cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a pod containing several edible seeds, which are widely used in various cuisines. Canavalia prolifica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soils.
